en:
Join the hundreds of researchers from around
           the world who are part of the Open Specy community by
           analyzing, sharing, processing, and identifying
           their Raman and IR spectra. These services are free and open source thanks to our partners:
haw:
E hui pū me nā haneli o nā mea noiʻi mai nā wahi a puni
           ka honua i ʻāpana o ke kaiāulu Open Specy e
           ka nānā ʻana, kaʻana like, ka hana ʻana, a me ka ʻike
           ko lākou Raman a me IR spectra. He manuahi a wehe ʻia kēia mau lawelawe i kā mākou mau hoa.

en:
In Brief: To use the tool upload a csv, asp, jdx, spc, or spa file to the upload file tab.
                                  If csv, one column should be named 'wavenumber' (in units of 1/cm) and another named 'intensity'.
                                  You can smooth your data using an SG filter, baseline correct your data using the polynomial order of iModPolyFit, and restrict the wavelength range for the match.
                                  The result will be compared to an internal Raman or FTIR spectra library. The strongest 1000 matches along with your
                                  uploaded or processed data will be presented in an interactive plot and table. For more details click the button below
                                  or watch the detailed instructional video.
haw:
I ka pōkole: No ka hoʻohana ʻana i ka mea hana e hoʻouka i kahi faila csv, asp, jdx, spc, a i ʻole spa i ka pā faila hoʻouka.
                                  Inā csv, pono e kapa ʻia kekahi kolamu 'helu hawewe' (ma nā ʻāpana o 1/cm) a i kapa ʻia kekahi kolamu 'intensity'.
                                  Hiki iā ʻoe ke hoʻomaʻemaʻe i kāu ʻikepili me ka hoʻohana ʻana i kahi kānana SG, hoʻoponopono i kāu ʻikepili me ka hoʻohana ʻana i ka polynomial order o iModPolyFit, a hoʻopaʻa i ka laulā hawewe no ka pāʻani.
                                  E hoʻohālikelike ʻia ka hopena me kahi waihona Raman kūloko a i ʻole FTIR spectra waihona. ʻO nā pāʻani 1000 ikaika loa me kāu
                                  e hōʻike ʻia nā ʻikepili i hoʻoili ʻia a i ʻole i hoʻoili ʻia ma kahi pākaukau a me ka papa. No ka ʻike hou aku e kaomi i ke pihi ma lalo
                                  a i ʻole e nānā i ke wikiō aʻo kikoʻī.

en:
Reference spectra was sourced from open access resources
           online, peer reviewed publications, and corporate donations. In the future
           spectra that is uploaded to the tool will be incorporated to the reference
           library to make it even better.
haw:
Loaʻa ʻia ka ʻike kikoʻī mai nā kumuwaiwai wehe
           ma ka pūnaewele, nā puke i nānā ʻia e nā hoa, a me nā haʻawina hui. I ka wā e hiki mai ana
           E hoʻokomo ʻia ka spectra i hoʻoili ʻia i ka hāmeʻa i ka kuhikuhi
           hale waihona puke e hoʻomaikaʻi ai.
ʻO ka metadata o ka waihona waihona ʻōlelo Raman

en:
To share spectra upload a file to the upload file tab. If you selected Share a copy of your spectra will be sent to the Community
           Data Warehouse on Open Science Framework. To add additional metadata, 
           fill in the avaliable metadata fields and click -Share Data-. The 
           spectra file that you uploaded along with your responses will be copied 
           to the a -With Metadata- subfolder at the link below. All shared data holds 
           a Creative Commons Attribution License 4.0.
haw:
No ka kaʻana like ʻana i ka spectra e hoʻouka i kahi faila i ka pā faila hoʻouka. Inā ʻoe i koho Kaʻana like e hoʻouna ʻia kahi kope o kāu spectra i ke Kaiāulu
           Hale Waihona ʻIkepili ma Open Science Framework. No ka hoʻohui ʻana i nā metadata hou,
           hoʻopiha i nā kahua metadata hiki ke kaomi -Share Data-. ʻO ka
           E kope ʻia ka faila spectra āu i hoʻouka ai me kāu mau pane
           i ka -Me Metadata- subfolder ma ka loulou ma lalo nei. Loaʻa nā ʻikepili like ʻole a pau
           a Creative Commons Attribution License 4.0.

en:
All parameters in this tool are tested to validate that 
           the tool is functioning as best as possible and determine the best default 
           parameters to use. Our current validation proceedure includes correcting 
           duplicated entries in the reference libraries, checking for spectra in 
           metadata that isn't in the spectral library, and ensuring the the default 
           parameters provide over 80% accuracy in the first match.
haw:
Hoʻāʻo ʻia nā ʻāpana āpau i kēia hāmeʻa e hōʻoia i kēlā
           ke hana nei ka mea hana e like me ka mea hiki loa a hoʻoholo i ka paʻamau maikaʻi loa
           nā ʻāpana e hoʻohana ai. ʻO kā mākou hana hōʻoia o kēia manawa e pili ana i ka hoʻoponopono
           hoʻokomo kope ʻia i loko o nā hale waihona puke, e nānā ana i ka spectra in
           metadata ʻaʻole i loko o ka hale waihona spectral, a me ka hōʻoia i ka paʻamau
           Hāʻawi nā ʻāpana ma luna o 80% pololei i ka pāʻani mua.

en: Updates, Feature Requests, and Bug Reports
haw: Nā mea hou, nā noi hiʻohiʻona, a me nā hōʻike Bug

en: We keep track of all updates using version control on our code. Features can be requested and bug reported on GitHub.
haw: Mālama mākou i nā mea hou a pau me ka hoʻohana ʻana i ka mana mana ma kā mākou code. Hiki ke noi ʻia nā hiʻohiʻona a hōʻike ʻia ka bug ma GitHub.
E noho hou i kēia lā!

en: Follow us on Twitter @OpenSpecy. E-mail wincowger@gmail.com to be added to the mailing list.
haw: E hahai mai iā mākou ma Twitter @OpenSpecy. E-mail wincowger@gmail.com e hoʻohui ʻia i ka papa inoa leka.

en: Free FTIR Software: siMPle microplastic IR spectral identification software
haw: Pūnaehana FTIR manuahi: polokalamu ʻike kikoʻī IR microplastic siMPle

en: Free Spectroscopy Learning Academy from ThermoFisher
haw: Hāʻawi ʻia ʻo Spectroscopy Learning Academy mai ThermoFisher

en: Free Optical Microscopy Learning Resource from Florida State University
haw: ʻO ke kumu aʻo ʻo Optical Microscopy manuahi mai Florida State University

en: Free desktop application for spectral analysis and links to reference databases.
haw: No ka hoʻohana ʻana i ka papa kuhikuhi manuahi a me nā loulou i nā ʻikepili kuhikuhi.
Nā ʻŌlelo a me nā Kūlana
Hoʻouka, Nānā, a kaʻana like i ka Spectra
E koho iā .csv (makemake), .asp, .jdx, .spc, .spa, a i ʻole .0 File

en:
If you like, we share your uploaded spectra and settings with the spectroscopy community.
           By default, all data will be licensed under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International (CC BY-NC 4.0).
           Uploaded spectra will appear here: https://osf.io/rjg3c
haw:
Inā makemake ʻoe, kaʻana like mākou i kāu kikoʻī a me nā hoʻonohonoho i hoʻoili ʻia me ke kaiāulu spectroscopy.
           Ma ka paʻamau, e laikini ʻia nā ʻikepili āpau ma lalo o Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International (CC BY-NC 4.0).
           E ʻike ʻia nā kikoʻī i hoʻouka ʻia ma aneʻi: https://osf.io/rjg3c

en:
Upload Raman or FTIR spectrum files as a csv, jdx, spc, or spa. A csv file is preferred. If a csv, the file must contain one column labeled 'wavenumber' in units of (1/cm) and another column labeled 'intensity' in absorbance units.
            If jdx, spc, spa, or 0 the file should be a single absorbance spectrum with wavenumber in (1/cm). These files will not always work perfectly because they are tricky to read so double check them in another software.
            Hit the 'Test Data' button to download a sample Raman spectrum.
haw:
Hoʻouka i nā faila kikoʻī Raman a i ʻole FTIR ma ke ʻano he csv, jdx, spc, a i ʻole spa. Makemake ʻia kahi faila csv. Inā he csv, pono ka waihona i hoʻokahi kolamu i kapa ʻia ʻo 'wavennumber' ma nā ʻāpana o (1/cm) a me kekahi kolamu i kapa ʻia ʻo 'intensity' i nā ʻāpana absorbance.
            Inā ʻo jdx, spc, spa, a i ʻole 0 pono ka faila i hoʻokahi kiko kikoʻī me ka helu hawewe ma (1/cm). ʻAʻole e hana maikaʻi kēia mau faila no ka mea paʻakikī lākou e heluhelu no laila e nānā pālua iā lākou ma kahi polokalamu ʻē aʻe.
            E kaomi i ke pihi 'Test Data' e hoʻoiho i kahi laʻana Raman spectrum.

en:
If the uploaded spectrum is not in absorbance units, 
           use this input to specify the units to convert from.Open Specy can 
           adjust reflectance or transmittance spectra to Absorbance units using 
           this drop down in the upload file tab. All of the preceding tabs 
           assume that the data is in absorbance units so you should make the 
           correction before continuing if needed. The transmittance adjustment 
           uses the log10(1/T) calculation which does not correct for system 
           and particle characteristics. The reflectance adjustment uses the 
           Kubelka-Munk equation (1-R)2/(2*R). We assume that the reflectance 
           is formatted as a percent from 1-100 and first correct the intensity by dividing by 100
           so that it fits the form expected by the equation.
           If none is selected, Open Specy assumes that the uploaded data is 
           an absorbance spectrum.
haw:
Inā ʻaʻole i loko o nā ʻāpana absorbance ka spectrum i hoʻouka ʻia,
           e hoʻohana i kēia hoʻokomo e kuhikuhi i nā ʻāpana e hoʻololi mai. Hiki iā Open Specy
           hoʻololi i ka reflectance a i ʻole transmittance spectra i nā ʻāpana Absorbance me ka hoʻohana ʻana
           kēia hāʻule i lalo i ka pā faila hoʻoili. ʻO nā papa mua a pau
           manaʻo ʻoe aia ka ʻikepili i nā ʻāpana absorbance no laila pono ʻoe e hana i ka
           hoʻoponopono ma mua o ka hoʻomau inā pono. ʻO ka hoʻoponopono transmittance
           hoʻohana i ka helu log10(1/T) i pololei ʻole no ka ʻōnaehana
           a me nā ʻano ʻāpana. Hoʻohana ka hoʻoponopono reflectance i ka
           Ka hoohalike Kubelka-Munk (1-R)2/(2*R). Manaʻo mākou ʻo ka reflectance
           Hoʻopili ʻia ma ke ʻano he pākēneka mai 1-100 a hoʻoponopono mua i ka ikaika ma ka puʻunaue ʻana me 100
           i kūpono i ke ʻano i manaʻo ʻia e ka hoohalike.
           Inā ʻaʻohe mea i koho ʻia, manaʻo ʻo Open Specy ʻo ka ʻikepili i hoʻoili ʻia
           he spectrum absorbance.

en: This is a sample spectrum that can be uploaded to the tool for testing it out and understanding how the csv files should be formatted.
haw: He laʻana spectrum kēia i hiki ke hoʻouka ʻia i ka mea paahana no ka hoʻāʻo ʻana a me ka hoʻomaopopo ʻana i ke ʻano o nā faila csv.

en:
We share any uploaded spectra and metadata with the spectroscopy community if you fill out the metadata here and select share.
           Uploaded spectra and metadata will appear here: https://osf.io/rjg3c
haw:
Kaʻana like mākou i nā spectra a me nā metadata i hoʻouka ʻia me ke kaiāulu spectroscopy inā ʻoe e hoʻopiha i ka metadata ma aneʻi a koho i kaʻana.
           E ʻike ʻia ka spectra a me ka metadata i hoʻouka ʻia ma aneʻi: https://osf.io/rjg3c

en: Upload some data to get started...
haw: Hoʻouka i kekahi ʻikepili e hoʻomaka ai...

en: Smooth, Baseline Correct, and Download Processed Spectra
haw: Smooth, Baseline Pololei, a hoʻoiho i ka Spectra i hana ʻia

en: Some users may wish to save a copy of their processed spectrum. This button downloads the processed spectrum as a csv file.
haw: Makemake paha kekahi mau mea hoʻohana e mālama i kope o kā lākou spectrum i hana ʻia. Hoʻoiho kēia pihi i ka spectrum i hana ʻia ma ke ʻano he faila csv.

en: This smoother can enhance the signal to noise ratio of the data and uses a Savitzky-Golay filter with 12 running data points and the polynomial specified.
haw: Hiki i kēia mea maʻalahi ke hoʻonui i ka hōʻailona noise ratio o ka ʻikepili a hoʻohana i kahi kānana Savitzky-Golay me 12 mau helu data holo a me ka polynomial i kuhikuhi ʻia.

en: This baseline correction routine has two options for baseline correction, 1) the polynomial imodpolyfit procedure to itteratively find the baseline of the spectrum using a polynomial fit to the entire region of the spectra. 2) manual lines can be drawn using the line tool on the plot and the correct button will use the lines to subtract the baseline.
haw: ʻElua mau koho no ka hoʻoponopono ʻana i ka papa kuhikuhi kumu, 1) ke kaʻina hana polynomial imodpolyfit e ʻike maʻalahi i ke kumu o ka spectrum me ka hoʻohana ʻana i ka polynomial kūpono i ka ʻāpana holoʻokoʻa o ka spectra. 2) hiki ke kaha kiʻi ʻia nā laina lima me ka hoʻohana ʻana i ka mea hana laina ma ka ʻāpana a e hoʻohana ke pihi pololei i nā laina e unuhi i ka palena.

en: Restricting the spectral range can remove regions of spectrum where no peaks exist and improve matching
haw: Hiki i ke kaohi ʻana i ka laulā kikoʻī ke hoʻoneʻe i nā wahi o ka spectrum kahi i loaʻa ʻole ai nā piko a hoʻomaikaʻi i ka hoʻohālikelike ʻana

en: Identify Spectrum Using the Reference Library
haw: E ʻike i ka Spectrum me ka hoʻohana ʻana i ka waihona Reference

en: This selection will determine whether the FTIR or Raman matching library is used. Choose the spectrum type that was uploaded.
haw: Na kēia koho e hoʻoholo inā hoʻohana ʻia ka waihona pili FTIR a i ʻole Raman. E koho i ke ʻano spectrum i hoʻoili ʻia.

en: This selection will determine whether the uploaded (not processed) spectrum or the spectrum processed using the processing tab is used in the spectrum match.
haw: Na kēia koho e hoʻoholo inā hoʻohana ʻia ka spectrum i hoʻoili ʻia (ʻaʻole i hoʻoponopono ʻia) a i ʻole ka spectrum i hoʻohana ʻia me ka pā hana i hoʻohana ʻia i ka pāʻani kikoʻī.
ʻĀpana e hoʻohālikelike i ke kōkua

en: This selection will determine whether the library you are matching to consists of the full spectrum or only spectrum peaks.
haw: Na kēia koho e hoʻoholo inā ʻo ka waihona āu e hoʻohālikelike nei me nā kiko kiko piha a i ʻole nā piko kikoʻī wale nō.

en: Help us reach our goal of revolutionizing spectroscopy.
haw: E kōkua iā mākou e hoʻokō i kā mākou pahuhopu e hoʻololi i ka spectroscopy.
Kūʻai mai ka hale kūʻai ʻo Swag

en: A paid team that is pushing Open Specy closer to the ultimate goal of 100% accurate spectral identification and deep spectral diagnostics with a single click
haw: ʻO kahi hui uku e koi ana iā Open Specy kokoke i ka pahuhopu hope loa o 100% pololei spectral identification a hohonu spectral diagnostics me hoʻokahi kaomi.

en: A single paid staff person working to update and build the community and the tool
haw: ʻO kahi limahana uku hoʻokahi e hana ana e hoʻonui a kūkulu i ke kaiāulu a me ka mea hana

en: Maintenance costs and minor ad-hoc updates and bug fixes
haw: ʻO nā kumukūʻai mālama a me nā mea hou ad-hoc liʻiliʻi a me nā hoʻoponopono bug

en: Keeping the app online and essential maintenance
haw: E mālama i ka polokalamu ma ka pūnaewele a me ka mālama pono
ʻO kahi mālama lōʻihi wale nō
Kaʻana ʻana i ka ʻikepili Metadata

en: Thank you for sharing your data!
haw: Mahalo iā ʻoe no ka hāʻawi ʻana i kāu ʻikepili!

en: Your data will soon be available at https://osf.io/stmv4/
haw: E loaʻa koke kāu ʻikepili ma https://osf.io/stmv4/
ʻAʻole kākoʻo ʻia ke ʻano ʻikepili!

en:
Uploaded data type is not currently supported; please
                      check tooltips and 'About' tab for details.
haw:
ʻAʻole kākoʻo ʻia ke ʻano ʻikepili i hoʻouka ʻia i kēia manawa; e 'oluʻolu
                      e nānā i nā mea hana a me ka 'About' tab no nā kikoʻī.
Kaʻana like Spectrum i ka Hale Waihona Puke Kaiaulu

en:
If you uploaded a text/csv file, make sure that the 
           columns are numeric and named 'wavenumber' and 
           'intensity'.
haw:
Inā hoʻouka ʻoe i kahi faila kikokikona/csv, e hōʻoia i ka
           He helu nā kolamu a ua kapa ʻia ʻo 'wavennumber' a
           'ikaika'.
